title: Facebook Bracing for an Election Night Without Results
text: Nathaniel Gleicher, Facebook Inc.’s head of cybersecurity policy, discusses the social network's preparations for the upcoming U.S. presidential election, and the actions it's taking against conspiracy groups including the far-right QAnon. On Thursday, Faceboook launched a voting information hub, which will include links to help people register to vote before the election. Gleicher speaks with Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: Facebook launches new effort it says will fight election misinformation
text: Nathaniel Gleicher, Facebook's head of security policy discusses steps the company is taking to launch a voting information center, and how it's working to protect disinformation about the election.

title: U.S. Justice Department going 'full tilt' on tech antitrust probe: official
text: The U.S. Justice Department is moving "full-tilt" on its antitrust investigation of Alphabet Inc’s Google and other Big Tech platforms, the department's second-ranking official told Reuters.

title: 3 Tech Stocks For Now and Beyond (Update): SQ, FB, OMCL
text: In today’s article we look at recent news and updates for 3 stocks that my firm has an investment in. Again, I have a personal stake in these companies.

title: Facebook adds labels to US posts about voting ahead of presidential election
text: Social network attempting to combat election-related misinformation on its platform with new voter information hub

title: Facebook hardens digital defense for misinformation ahead of elections
text: U.S. users of Facebook Inc. who post about voting may soon start seeing fact-checking notes added to their messages about the presidential election on Nov.

title: Facebook taking new steps to stop election misinformation
text: Yahoo Finance's Rick Newman reports Facebook efforts to stop election misinformation on its social media platform.

title: Facebook Faces New Flashpoint With Trump Over Campaign To Push Voting By Mail
text: The platform is launching a Voter Information Centre on Thursday, providing U.S. users with facts about voting and helping users request absentee mail-in ballots, a practice slammed by Trump on the social media platform.

title: Facebook will roll out voting information center this week
text: Facebook COO Cheryl Sandeberg joined CNBC's small business playbook virtual summit yesterday and announced that Facebook will roll out more information on voting for users.

title: Bracing for election day, Facebook rolls out voting resources to U.S. users
text: Eager to avoid a repeat of its disastrous role as a super-spreader of misinformation during the 2016 election cycle, Facebook is getting its ducks in a row. Following an announcement earlier this summer, the company is now launching a voting information hub that will centralize election resources for U.S.

title: Facebook launches online hub so you can find voting information
text: The new center lets Facebook and Instagram users check if they're registered to vote and see facts about voting.
